result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Longley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amanda L Longley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amanda L Longley was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Amanda L Longley was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
Remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

Defendants brief on motion for postconviction relief

Parties to brief on motion for postconviction relief as follows:
Defendant's brief due December 12, 2016
Plaintiff's response brief due January 9, 2017
Defendant's reply brief due January 23, 2017

Court Reporter: Jennifer Poirior
Motion Hearing, November 4, 2016

Defendant in court with Attorney Brandon Kuhl.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for postconviction relief. Argument. Stipulation as to conviction date and conviction violations put on record. Attorney Laura Breun duly sworn and testified. DE waives right to attorney client privilege and confidentiality. Direct by Atty Kuhl. Atty Payal Khandhar duly sworn and testified. DE waives attorney client privilege and confidentiality. Direct by Atty Kuhl. Cross. DE duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty Kuhl. Cross. Redirect. Ct sets briefing schedule on topics of 1 - whether this circuit court is bound by Cocina (why or why not), 2 - whether circuit courts must inform DE of the Federal firearm prohibition on misd cases with domestic enhancer (include factors to be considered), 3 - the relief if the answer to #2 is yes, 4 - the retroactive effect on other cases. 5 - ineffective assistance of counsel: what it means, what the court has to find and what was deficient performance. Burden of proof on all 5 points: who carries it and to what standard. DE brief due 12/12/16. State's response due 1/9/17. DE's final reply due 1/23/17.

Trial Judge - Br 11

Defendant appeared.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 09:45 am.
